result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda J Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • MA-Fraud/Benefit Application (Items), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 49.49(1)(a)1.
  • MA-Fraud/Benefit Application (Items), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 49.49(1)(a)1.
  • MA-Fraud/Benefit Application (Items), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 49.49(1)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court has no objection to transferring probation to Walworth Co.

miscConds.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
***
***JOC IS AMENDED TO VACATE THE DNA SURCHARGE FROM CTS 2 & 3***

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include: psychiatric/psychological.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $28,538.37 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with Blanca E or her family/residence, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Court has no objection to transferring probation to Walworth Co.

timeConds.notes:
Huber and work crew authorized.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.addlTxt:
Assistant Attorney General Michelle Viste appears for the State. Defendant, Linda J Turner, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 5 years with conditions.  As a condition she is ordered to serve 90 days in the KCJ commencing on 6/25/16 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.   Restitution is ordered in the amount of $28,538.37 and there was no objection by the DE.  Atty Viste to draft the restitution order.  Court costs also ordered.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Blanca E. or her family/residence.  Atty Celebre requests the documents that were attached to his letter and received by the court on 6/2/16 be sealed and State has no objection so motion is granted by the court.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Letter from Open Arms Free Clinic, Inc
received from Atty Celebre with more attached letters of recommendation
received from Atty Celebre w/ attached letters of recommendation

Count 3
Count 2 - Guilty

Exhibits S1-S7, S9-S11 and S13 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 4/15/16. vm

DAY 3 - Continued.  Same appearances as yesterday.
Atty Viste moves to amend pleadings and Atty Celebre objects.  Upon hearing arguments State's motion is granted and date is amended.  Testimony of Defendant resumes.  Defense rests.  No rebuttal and evidence is closed.  Jury instructions are given to the jurors.  Court breaks for lunch and jurors are instructed to remain at 1:15 PM for closing arguments.  Jury instructions are given to the jurors.  Closing arguments made.  Alternate Juror - Jean D. is excused at 2:05 PM.  Jury begins deliberation at 2:09 PM.  Verdict reached at 3:20 PM.  Jury finds defendant Guilty on all 3 counts.  Jury polled and released at 3:20 PM. State moves for judgment on the verdict and motion is granted.  Defendant is adjudged guilty on all 3 counts.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing on 6/16/16 at 11:00 AM.  Bond continues.
Blank Verdict Forms

DAY 2 - Assistant Attorney General Michelle Viste appears for the State along with Assistant Attorney General Katie Wilson and Investigative Supervisor Rose Slattery. Defendant, Linda J Turner, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Clerk: PT
Sworn in and testiified are State's witnesses:  Ann N. - Hewlitt Packard Enterprise and Rose S. - Investigator WI Dept of Justice.  Exhibits 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 10 and 11 are received and Exhibit 10 published to the jury.  Defendant advised of her rights to testify.  State rests.  Atty Celebre moves for a direct verdict and motion is denied.  Defendant elects to testify and is sworn in and testified.  Court breaks for the day at 1:50 PM and jurors are instructed to return at 8:30 AM.
Jury Seating Chart - Voir Dire
and Peremptory Challenges

Assistant Attorney General Michelle Viste appears for the State along with Assistant Attorney General Katie Wilson and Investigative Supervisor Rose Slattery. Defendant, Linda J Turner, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Interpreter Leo Martin in court.  Clerk: PT
Ruling made on motions in limine as set forth on record.  Witnesses are excluded during trial.  Jury summoned and first oath is given to the jury panel.  Voir dire commences at 9:10 AM and completed at 10:29 AM.  Unselected jurors released at this time.  Final oath is given to jurors.  Preliminary instructions are given to the jurors and opening statements are made.  Interpreter Martin is sworn in to interpret for State's witnesses Blanca E. and Maria E.  Blanca E. is sworn in and testified.  Maria E. is sworn in and testified.  Exhibits 1 & 2 are received.  Court breaks for lunch and jurors are instructed to return at 1:15 PM.  Testimony of Maria E. resumes.  Sworn in and testified is State's witness: Cynthia G. - Childrens Hospital.  Exhibit 3 is received.  Sworn in and testified is State's witness: Eduardo T. - Medicaid Claims Specialist.  Court breaks for the day at 5:02 PM and jurors are instructed to return at 8:30 AM.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  AAG Katie Wilson appeared in person on behalf of plaintiff.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty David Celebre.  Testimony taken from Dr. Deborah Collins.  Exhibit #1 offered/received.  State rests.  Court takes a short recess to allow Atty Celebre to confer w/his client.  Court reconvenes.  Testimony taken from deft.  No further evidence presented by either side.  Arguments heard.  Court finds the deft is competent to proceed in this matter and has the mental capacity to assist her atty in her defense.  JSH set for 3/17/16 @ 1pm.  JT set for 3/2/16 @ 8:30am.  AAG Wilson may either appear via telephone for the JSH.
